title: cant move/ attempting to reconnect at start of every game
body: SO for the last month i have had these strangest thing where 90% of my games i connect and at the very start i can buy 1 item and then nothing else, i then cant move or learn skills but yet i can talk to others perfectly and see them moving around normally, this is god damn annoying and i need a fix, i've done a repair and reinstall..

replies.body: Who's your ISP and what's your OS?

Internode is my isp and windows 8.1 64bit system

i shouldnt have any issues as i have a $300 router and NBN (optic fibre)

I'm not too aware of the reputation Internode has with Riot, so I'm not ruling out it as a problem on your ISPs end, but we can leave that for later.

Windows 8.1 is not officially supported by Riot Games yet also. There could simply be a compatibility issue. Have you tried running League in compatibility mode for Windows 7?

Firstly, though, are you currently using any VPNs? If you are, try disabling them and then play a game. See if that works.

If it doesn't, one thing you should try is [changing your DNS to Google's Public one](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4). Make sure you remember your previous settings, as changing the DNS could have negative results for other applications (like data metering and whatnot). You'd want to be able to reset it at any time. Remember to flush your DNS and reset your computer for each change!

Another thing you can try is port forwarding. This is mostly to speed up a connection *slightly* and to open up its NAT. It's a bit hard if you haven't already attempted it, so if you can find a solution that doesn't involve port forwarding you're probably better off doing that. [Here's Riot's guide in case you want to get started by yourself](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq7), though it fails to mention a few requirements and other things. You should ask me first if you'd like to attempt that.

I guess that's all I can suggest for now. Best of luck!
